etymology.description: 凑(湊) (còu, "gather together") and 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") combine to form a colloquial phrase.
etymology.interpretation: In the phrase 凑凑火(湊湊火), 凑凑(湊湊) (còucòu, "make do") and 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") suggest the practice of making do with what is available for a meal, symbolized by creating a fire. It implies making something work or managing with limited resources.

examples.chinese: 今晚的晚饭只能凑凑火(今晚的晚飯只能湊湊火)。
examples.pinyin: jīn wǎn de wǎn fàn zhǐ néng còu còu huǒ
examples.english: Tonight's dinner can only make do with a simple meal.

examples.chinese: 朋友邀约聚餐(朋友邀約聚餐)，他只好凑凑火应付(他只好湊湊火應付)。
examples.pinyin: péng yǒu yāo yuē jù cān, tā zhǐ hǎo còu còu huǒ yìng fù
examples.english: When friends invite him to a dinner, he can only make do with a modest meal.
